column1: This is a list of earthquakes in 2016. Only earthquakes of magnitude 6 or above are included
column2: unless they result in damage and/or casualties
column3: or are notable for some other reason.  All dates are listed according to UTC time. Maximum intensities are indicated on the Mercalli intensity scale and are sourced from United States Geological Survey (USGS) ShakeMap data. Major events took place in Ecuador
column6: Indonesia and New Zealand this year
column7: while the strongest tremor was observed in Papua New Guinea. 2016 was also the first year since 2008 with no magnitude 8+ earthquakes.

column1: == Compared to other years ==
An increase in detected earthquake numbers does not necessarily represent an increase in earthquakes per se. Population increase
column2: habitation spread
column3: and advances in earthquake detection technology all contribute to higher earthquake numbers being recorded over time.

column1: == By death toll ==
Listed are earthquakes with at least 10 dead.
== By magnitude ==
Listed are earthquakes with at least 7.0 magnitude.
== By month ==
=== January ===
A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck the Western Indian-Antarctic Ridge on January 1 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).

A magnitude 6.7 earthquake struck India 30 km (19 mi) west of Imphal in the state of Manipur on January 3 at a depth of 55.0 km (34.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). At least 11 people were killed (six in India and five in Bangladesh)
column2: 200 others were injured and a large number of buildings were damaged.

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck the Pacific-Antarctic Ridge on January 5 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).
A magnitude 6.5 earthquake struck Indonesia 8 km (5.0 mi) east of the Talaud Islands
column2: North Sulawesi on January 11 at a depth of 13.0 km (8.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe).

column1: A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck Japan 74 km (46 mi) northwest of Rumoi on the island of Hokkaido on January 11 at a depth of 238.8 km (148.4 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck Bolivia 12 km (7.5 mi) west northwest of Charagua
column2: Cordillera Province on January 14 at a depth of 582.6 km (362.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of II (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 6.7 earthquake struck offshore of Japan 52 km (32 mi) southeast of Shizunai on the island of Hokkaido on January 14 at a depth of 46.0 km (28.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).
A magnitude 5.6 earthquake struck Indonesia 69 km (43 mi) south southeast of Namlea
column2: Maluku on January 16 at a depth of 4.1 km (2.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). One person died
column3: 19 were injured and about 120 houses were damaged in two villages on Ambelau island.

column1: A magnitude 5.9 earthquake struck China 70 km (43 mi) east southeast of Hongtu
column2: Qinghai province on January 20 at a depth of 9.0 km (5.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). Nine people were injured and 600 houses were damaged.

column1: A magnitude 6.6 earthquake struck offshore of Mexico 215 km (134 mi) southwest of Tomatlán
column2: Jalisco state on January 21 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 7.1 earthquake struck the United States 86 km (53 mi) east of Old Iliamna
column2: Alaska on January 24 at a depth of 129.0 km (80.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). Four homes were destroyed in Kenai after a gas leak.

column1: A magnitude 4.4 earthquake struck Ethiopia 4 km (2.5 mi) north northeast of Awasa on January 24 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). About 100 students sustained minor injuries and there were power outages in Awasa.

A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck offshore of Morocco 50 km (31 mi) north northeast of Al Hoceima on January 25 at a depth of 12.0 km (7.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). One person died
column2: fifteen were injured and some buildings were damaged; it also caused a blackout in the region.

column1: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of Papua New Guinea 94 km (58 mi) south southeast of Taron
column2: New Ireland on January 26 at a depth of 26.0 km (16.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 7.2 earthquake struck Russia 88 km (55 mi) north of Yelizovo on the Kamchatka Peninsula on January 30 at a depth of 177.0 km (110.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).

A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of Antarctica 473 km (294 mi) northeast of the Balleny Islands on January 31 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).
=== February ===

A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck offshore of New Zealand 125 km (78 mi) northwest of L'Esperance Rock on February 1 at a depth of 391.0 km (243.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).

A magnitude 5.2 earthquake struck Nepal 19 km (12 mi) north of Kathmandu on February 5 at a depth of 23.5 km (14.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). 66 people were injured in Nepal during this earthquake
column2: while one person died of a heart attack in Muzaffarpur
column3: India.

column1: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck Taiwan 25 km (16 mi) southeast of the Yujing district of Tainan City on February 6 at a depth of 23.0 km (14.3 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). Numerous buildings
column2: including a residential tower
column3: collapsed in Yongkang district. 117 people were killed and 550 were injured.

column1: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck offshore of Papua New Guinea 88 km (55 mi) west southwest of Panguna on February 8 at a depth of 29.0 km (18.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).
A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck Chile 36 km (22 mi) west of Ovalle on February 10 at a depth of 29.0 km (18.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong).
A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck Indonesia 0 km (0 mi) west of Komerda
column2: East Nusa Tenggara on February 12 at a depth of 28.0 km (17.4 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).

column1: A magnitude 5.8 earthquake struck New Zealand 12 km (7.5 mi) east northeast of Christchurch on February 14 at a depth of 7.6 km (4.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe). Minor damage was reported and parts of the region suffered from liquefaction. A part of Godley Head collapsed and other cliffs collapsed as well.
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of Tonga 32 km (20 mi) west northwest of Nuku`alofa on February 15 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck the southern East Pacific Rise on February 16 at a depth of 13.0 km (8.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Indonesia 151 km (94 mi) southeast of Tobelo on February 17 at a depth of 9.0 km (5.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).

A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Chile 105 km (65 mi) west southwest of Coquimbo on February 22 at a depth of 12.0 km (7.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light). This was an aftershock of the 6.3 quake.
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck the Western Pacific-Antarctic Ridge on February 27 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).
=== March ===
A magnitude 7.8 earthquake struck offshore of Indonesia 659 km (409 mi) southwest of Muara Siberut
column2: Mentawai Islands on March 2 at a depth of 24.0 km (14.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck offshore of the United States 72 km (45 mi) south southeast of Atka
column2: Alaska on March 12 at a depth of 19.0 km (11.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of the United States 75 km (47 mi) south of Atka
column2: Alaska on March 19 at a depth of 17.0 km (10.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light). This was an aftershock of the 6.3 quake.

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of Antigua and Barbuda 124 km (77 mi) east northeast of Codrington on March 19 at a depth of 26.0 km (16.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).
A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck offshore of Russia 216 km (134 mi) south of Ust'-Kamchatsk Staryy
column2: Kamchatka Peninsula on March 20 at a depth of 30.0 km (18.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: === April ===
A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck Papua New Guinea 119 km (74 mi) northeast of Angoram
column2: East Sepik on April 1 at a depth of 6.0 km (3.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).

column1: A magnitude 6.9 earthquake struck Vanuatu 83 km (52 mi) north northwest of Port-Olry on April 3 at a depth of 26.0 km (16.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).

A magnitude 6.7 earthquake struck Vanuatu 102 km (63 mi) west southwest of Sola on April 6 at a depth of 24.0 km (14.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). This was an aftershock of the 6.9 quake.
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of Indonesia 71 km (44 mi) south southwest of Bunisari
column2: West Java on April 6 at a depth of 29.0 km (18.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 6.7 earthquake struck Vanuatu 103 km (64 mi) west of Sola on April 7 at a depth of 27.6 km (17.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). This was an aftershock of the 6.9 quake.
A magnitude 4.1 earthquake struck Nepal 4 km (2.5 mi) south southwest of Patan on April 9 at a depth of 10.2 km (6.3 mi). At least three people were injured.
A magnitude 6.6 earthquake struck Afghanistan 42 km (26 mi) west southwest of Ashkasham
column2: Badakhshan Province on April 10 at a depth of 212.0 km (131.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light). Six people were killed and forty-six injured in Pakistan.

column1: A magnitude 6.9 earthquake struck Myanmar 75 km (47 mi) southeast of Mawlaik on April 13 at a depth of 136.0 km (84.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). 2 people were killed and 70 injured in Assam
column2: India. 50 people were hurt in Chittagong
column3: Bangladesh.

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck the Philippines 15 km (9.3 mi) northwest of Siocon
column2: Zamboanga del Norte on April 13 at a depth of 17.0 km (10.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong).

column1: A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck Japan 3 km (1.9 mi) west of Kumamoto City on April 14 at a depth of 9.0 km (5.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe). Nine people were killed
column2: while more than 800 others were injured. At least 20 homes and a wall of the Kumamoto Castle collapsed
column3: while more than 24
column4: 000 people were forced to spend several nights in shelters. This was a foreshock of the 7.0 quake.

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Japan 5 km (3.1 mi) east northeast of Uto
column2: Kumamoto Prefecture on April 14 at a depth of 8.0 km (5.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe). This was a foreshock of the 7.0 quake.

column1: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck Vanuatu 87 km (54 mi) northwest of Port-Olry on April 14 at a depth of 16.0 km (9.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). This was an aftershock of the 6.9 quake.
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of Guatemala 110 km (68 mi) south southwest of Champerico
column2: Retalhuleu department on April 15 at a depth of 22.4 km (13.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 7.0 earthquake struck Japan 1 km (0.62 mi) east of Kumamoto City on April 15 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi).  The shock had a maximum intensity of IX (Violent). 41 people were killed and more than 1
column2: 000 others were injured. 8
column3: 700 buildings were damaged and a bridge collapsed in Aso

column1: A magnitude 7.8 earthquake struck Ecuador 27 km (17 mi) south southeast of Muisne in Esmeraldas province on April 16 at a depth of 20.6 km (12.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe).  668 people were killed
column2: 8 missing and over 6
column3: 200 injured. 7

column1: A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck offshore of South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands 108 km (67 mi) north of Visokoi Island on April 19 at a depth of 14.0 km (8.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck Ecuador 20 km (12 mi) west northwest of Muisne in Esmeraldas province on April 20 at a depth of 14.0 km (8.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake.

A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Ecuador 11 km (6.8 mi) north of Muisne in Esmeraldas province on April 20 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake.

A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Ecuador 35 km (22 mi) north northwest of Bahia de Caraquez in Manabi province on April 22 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake.
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of Mexico 83 km (52 mi) west southwest of Puerto Madero
column2: Chiapas on April 25 at a depth of 16.0 km (9.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of Mexico 75 km (47 mi) west southwest of Puerto Madero
column2: Chiapas on April 27 at a depth of 16.0 km (9.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light). This was an aftershock of the 6.0 quake.

column1: A magnitude 7.0 earthquake struck Vanuatu 2 km (1.2 mi) north of Norsup on April 28 at a depth of 24.0 km (14.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong).

A magnitude 6.6 earthquake struck 602 km (374 mi) east of the French Pacific minor territory of Clipperton Island on April 29 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).
A magnitude 5.2 earthquake struck China 66 km (41 mi) northwest of Gyamotang
column2: Tibet Autonomous Region on May 11 at a depth of 8.0 km (5.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). Sixty people were reported injured
column3: six seriously; with collapsed houses and bridges and roads damaged due to landslides.

column1: A magnitude 6.7 earthquake struck Ecuador 33 km (21 mi) southeast of Muisne in Esmeraldas province on May 18 at a depth of 16.0 km (9.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). Power cuts were reported near the epicenter. This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake in April.

A magnitude 6.9 earthquake struck Ecuador 24 km (15 mi) northwest of Rosa Zarate (also called Quinindé) in Esmeraldas province on May 18 at a depth of 29.9 km (18.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). One person was killed in Tosagua. This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake in April.
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Australia 337 km (209 mi) east of Warburton in Western Australia on May 20 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe).

A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck Fiji 18 km (11 mi) south southeast of Ndoi Island on May 27 at a depth of 567.5 km (352.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of II (Weak). This was an foreshock of the 6.9 quake.
A magnitude 6.9 earthquake struck offshore of Fiji 155 km (96 mi) south southeast of Ndoi Island on May 28 at a depth of 405.7 km (252.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).

A magnitude 7.2 earthquake struck offshore of South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands 53 km (33 mi) north northeast of Visokoi Island on May 28 at a depth of 78.0 km (48.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).
A magnitude 5.4 earthquake struck Algeria 16 km (9.9 mi) south southwest of Lakhdaria
column2: Bouïra Province on May 29 at a depth of 11.4 km (7.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). Some houses and buildings collapsed in the region
column3: and 28 people were injured

column1: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck offshore of Taiwan 94 km (58 mi) east northeast of Keelung on May 31 at a depth of 246.4 km (153.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).
=== June ===
A magnitude 6.6 earthquake struck Indonesia 79 km (49 mi) west of Sungai Penuh
column2: Jambi on June 1 at a depth of 50.0 km (31.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). One person died of a heart attack during this earthquake
column3: 18 were injured and more than 2

column1: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck Indonesia 133 km (83 mi) southwest of Leksula
column2: Maluku on June 5 at a depth of 429.6 km (266.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of New Zealand 84 km (52 mi) south of Raoul Island on June 6 at a depth of 43.8 km (27.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).
A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck offshore of Mexico 106 km (66 mi) south southwest of San Patricio
column2: Jalisco state on June 7 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck Indonesia 123 km (76 mi) west northwest of Kota Ternate
column2: North Maluku on June 7 at a depth of 31.0 km (19.3 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).

column1: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of Indonesia 260 km (160 mi) south of Kute
column2: West Nusa Tenggara on June 9 at a depth of 19.0 km (11.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck Nicaragua 22 km (14 mi) east of Puerto Morazan
column2: Chinandega on June 10 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe). Some houses suffered damage in Chinandega
column3: but no injuries were reported.

column1: A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck the Solomon Islands 18 km (11 mi) west northwest of Auki on June 10 at a depth of 30.4 km (18.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).
A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck Vanuatu 98 km (61 mi) north northwest of Isangel on June 14 at a depth of 111.0 km (69.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).
A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck offshore of Vanuatu 83 km (52 mi) south southwest of Isangel on June 19 at a depth of 13.0 km (8.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).

A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of Vanuatu 90 km (56 mi) southwest of Isangel on June 20 at a depth of 15.0 km (9.3 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light). This was an aftershock of the 6.3 quake.
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck the Northern Mid-Atlantic Ridge on June 21 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).
A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck Papua New Guinea 67 km (42 mi) west northwest of Namatanai
column2: New Ireland on June 21 at a depth of 354.0 km (220.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck Kyrgyzstan 28 km (17 mi) south southeast of Sary-Tash on June 26 at a depth of 13.0 km (8.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong).
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Vanuatu 8 km (5.0 mi) northeast of Lakatoro on June 30 at a depth of 27.0 km (16.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).
=== July ===
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of Tonga 112 km (70 mi) north northeast of Hihifo on July 10 at a depth of 8.0 km (5.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck Ecuador 33 km (21 mi) northwest of Rosa Zarate (also called Quinindé) in Esmeraldas province on July 11 at a depth of 21.0 km (13.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). Two people died during this earthquake.
A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck offshore of New Zealand 199 km (124 mi) northeast of Raoul Island on July 13 at a depth of 12.0 km (7.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck Vanuatu 72 km (45 mi) north northwest of Isangel on July 20 at a depth of 167.0 km (103.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck Chile 54 km (34 mi) west northwest of the city of Diego de Almagro on July 25 at a depth of 72.0 km (44.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).
A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck Papua New Guinea 134 km (83 mi) southeast of Lorengau
column2: Manus on July 25 at a depth of 14.0 km (8.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 7.7 earthquake struck offshore of the United States trust territory of the Northern Mariana Islands 29 km (18 mi) southwest of Agrihan on July 29 at a depth of 196.0 km (121.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).
=== August ===

A magnitude 5.0 earthquake struck Azerbaijan 12 km (7.5 mi) northwest of Imishli on August 1 at a depth of 16.0 km (9.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). One man died of a heart attack in Parsabad
column2: in the far northwest of Iran.

column1: A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck Argentina 49 km (30 mi) west southwest of La Quiaca
column2: Jujuy on August 4 at a depth of 270.0 km (167.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck offshore of Japan 71 km (44 mi) east northeast of Iwo Jima on August 4 at a depth of 510.0 km (316.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of II (Weak).

A magnitude 7.2 earthquake struck offshore of the French Pacific special collectivity of New Caledonia 110 km (68 mi) east of Île Hunter on August 12 at a depth of 16.4 km (10.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of Tonga 225 km (140 mi) southeast of the Minerva Reefs on August 12 at a depth of 112.8 km (70.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).
A magnitude 5.5 earthquake struck Peru 39 km (24 mi) north of Lluta
column2: Arequipa Province on August 15 at a depth of 20.0 km (12.4 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). The quake caused five deaths
column3: including an American tourist

column1: A magnitude 5.7 earthquake struck Australia 54 km (34 mi) east northeast of Bowen in Queensland on August 18 at a depth of 7.8 km (4.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). The quake
column2: the highest magnitude to affect Queensland in 20 years
column3: caused minor damage and briefly caused the evacuation of some airports.

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck the southern East Pacific Rise on August 18 at a depth of 10 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).

A magnitude 7.4 earthquake struck offshore of South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands 240 km (150 mi) east southeast of South Georgia on August 19 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of Japan 169 km (105 mi) east northeast of Miyako
column2: Iwate Prefecture on August 20 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands 240 km (150 mi) east southeast of South Georgia on August 21 at a depth of 12.0 km (7.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt). This was an aftershock of the 7.4 quake.
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Indonesia 132 km (82 mi) north of Nebe
column2: East Nusa Tenggara on August 23 at a depth of 533.0 km (331.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of II (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck Italy 10 km (6.2 mi) southeast of Norcia on August 24 at a depth of 4.4 km (2.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IX (Violent). 299 people of various nations were killed
column2: 388 were injured
column3: with heavy damage all around the epicenter

column1: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck Myanmar 26 km (16 mi) west of Chauk on August 24 at a depth of 82.0 km (51.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). Four people died
column2: 20 were injured
column3: and various stupas in Bagan were damaged.

column1: A magnitude 7.1 earthquake struck offshore of Ascension Island 980 km (610 mi) north northwest of the island on August 29 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of I (Not felt).
A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck Papua New Guinea 39 km (24 mi) east of Namatanai
column2: New Ireland on August 31 at a depth of 476.0 km (295.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).

column1: === September ===

A magnitude 7.0 earthquake struck offshore of New Zealand 175 km (109 mi) northeast of Gisborne on September 1 at a depth of 19.0 km (11.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). A tsunami warning was issued after this earthquake
column2: and waves of 30.0 cm (11.8 in) were reported near Gisborne.

column1: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of New Zealand 185 km (115 mi) northeast of Opotiki on September 1 at a depth of 13.7 km (8.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light). This was an aftershock of the 7.0 quake.
A magnitude 5.8 earthquake struck the United States 14 km (8.7 mi) northwest of Pawnee
column2: Oklahoma on September 3 at a depth of 5.6 km (3.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). It is the strongest earthquake ever recorded within the state. One person was injured
column3: and the earthquake caused moderate damage
column4: especially in Pawnee where buildings were damaged.

column1: A magnitude 4.7 earthquake struck Ecuador 22 km (14 mi) east northeast of Quito on September 5 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). Six people were injured in nearby Quito during this earthquake
column2: and some damage was caused.

column1: A magnitude 4.7 earthquake struck Pakistan 8 km (5.0 mi) east northeast of Batgram on September 5 at a depth of 25.9 km (16.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak). Fifty-seven people were injured in a panicked evacuation of a school. Of those 57
column2: three are reported to be in critical condition.

column1: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of Russia 185 km (115 mi) east southeast of Nikolskoye
column2: Kamchatka Krai on September 5 at a depth of 8.0 km (5.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).

column1: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck Australia 21 km (13 mi) southwest of Macquarie Island on September 8 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong).
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck Peru 52 km (32 mi) north of Moyobamba
column2: Moyobamba Province on September 10 at a depth of 121.0 km (75.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 5.9 earthquake struck Tanzania 27 km (17 mi) northeast of Nsunga
column2: Kagera Region on September 10 at a depth of 40.0 km (24.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). Nineteen people were killed and 252 injured in Tanzania  as well as four people killed and seven injured in Uganda's Rakai District. Several houses collapsed in the Kangera regional capital of Bukoba and in Uganda.

column1: A magnitude 5.1 earthquake struck Macedonia 4 km (2.5 mi) east northeast of Skopje on September 11 at a depth of 12.9 km (8.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). The quake caused minor damage to buildings and 30 people were injured while leaving their homes in a panic.
A magnitude 5.4 earthquake struck South Korea 6 km (3.7 mi) south of Gyeongju
column2: North Gyeongsang Province on September 12 at a depth of 13.0 km (8.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). It is the strongest earthquake ever recorded in South Korea. Eight people were injured and 253 properties damaged.

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Colombia 32 km (20 mi) east northeast of Mutatá
column2: Antioquia on September 14 at a depth of 18.0 km (11.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong).

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck the Solomon Islands 86 km (53 mi) west of Honiara on September 14 at a depth of 14.0 km (8.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of Indonesia 51 km (32 mi) north northwest of Jayapura
column2: Papua on September 17 at a depth of 9.0 km (5.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of Japan 360 km (220 mi) southeast of Hachijō-jima
column2: Izu Islands on September 20 at a depth of 9.0 km (5.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 4.6 earthquake struck Pakistan 11 km (6.8 mi) north of Sann on September 22 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock killed one person and left nine others injured in Hyderabad.
A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck offshore of Japan 143 km (89 mi) east southeast of Katsuura
column2: Chiba Prefecture on September 23 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 4.8 earthquake struck Burundi 24 km (15 mi) southeast of Cyangugu
column2: Rwanda
column3: on September 23 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). The quake killed 6 people and injured 5 others in the neighbouring Democratic Republic of the Congo. In Rwanda
column4: this earthquake also killed one person
column5: and injured more than 20 when various houses collapsed in Rusizi district.

column1: A magnitude 5.6 earthquake struck Romania 8 km (5.0 mi) west northwest of Nereju on September 23 at a depth of 92.0 km (57.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). Two people were injured.
A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck the Philippines 36 km (22 mi) southeast of Tamisan
column2: Davao Oriental
column3: on September 24 at a depth of 65.0 km (40.4 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).

column1: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck offshore of Tonga 118 km (73 mi) west northwest of Neiafu on September 24 at a depth of 202.0 km (125.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).
A magnitude 6.9 earthquake struck Fiji 107 km (66 mi) north northeast of Ndoi Island on September 24 at a depth of 596.4 km (370.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).
A magnitude 5.5 earthquake struck Nicaragua 20 km (12 mi) north northeast of Nagarote
column2: León department on September 28 at a depth of 7.1 km (4.4 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). One person died of a heart attack during this earthquake
column3: five others were injured and some houses collapsed in La Paz Centro.

column1: === October ===

A magnitude 5.4 earthquake struck Pakistan 42 km (26 mi) north northwest of Athmuqam on October 1 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). Two people died and thirty others were injured.
A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck Papua New Guinea 143 km (89 mi) north of Kimbe
column2: West New Britain on October 15 at a depth of 442.0 km (274.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 5.5 earthquake struck Greece 12 km (7.5 mi) north northwest of Rodotopion
column2: Epirus on October 15 at a depth of 22.0 km (13.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light). The quake damaged some buildings in villages near Ioannina.

column1: A magnitude 5.0 earthquake struck Peru 28 km (17 mi) southwest of Pimentel
column2: Lambayeque Region on October 16 at a depth of 40.7 km (25.3 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). One person died in Lambayeque when a floor lamp fell on her.

column1: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck Papua New Guinea 77 km (48 mi) west northwest of Kandrian
column2: West New Britain on October 17 at a depth of 42.0 km (26.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong).

column1: A magnitude 5.9 earthquake struck China 135 km (84 mi) northeast of Dartang
column2: Tibet Autonomous Region on October 17 at a depth of 23.3 km (14.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). One person died during this earthquake.

column1: A magnitude 6.6 earthquake struck Indonesia 161 km (100 mi) north northwest of Pamanukan
column2: West Java on October 19 at a depth of 614.0 km (381.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of III (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck Japan 6 km (3.7 mi) south of Kurayoshi
column2: Tottori Prefecture on October 21 at a depth of 5.6 km (3.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe). At least 20 people were injured and some damage was caused.

column1: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck offshore of Tonga 132 km (82 mi) west northwest of Hihifo on October 26 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

A magnitude 5.5 earthquake struck Italy 8 km (5.0 mi) east southeast of Sellano on October 26 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). Several buildings collapsed. Two people were injured. This was a foreshock of the 6.6 quake.

A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck Italy 3 km (1.9 mi) north northwest of Visso on October 26 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IX (Violent). One person died of a heart attack during this earthquake and 8 others were injured when various houses collapsed in the region of Marche. This was a foreshock of the 6.6 quake.
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of Chile 86 km (53 mi) west southwest of San Antonio on October 27 at a depth of 12.6 km (7.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

A magnitude 6.6 earthquake struck Italy 7 km (4.3 mi) north of Norcia on October 30 at a depth of 8.0 km (5.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IX (Violent). The villages of Arquata del Tronto
column2: Visso
column3: Castelsantangelo sul Nera
column5: as well as the Basilica of Saint Benedict in Norcia
column6: were destroyed. Two people died of heart attacks during this earthquake and 20 others were injured.

column1: A magnitude 5.6 earthquake struck Colombia 35 km (22 mi) east of the town of Colombia on October 31 at a depth of 33.0 km (20.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light). The widespread damage caused by the earthquake led to a declaration of public disaster by the Colombian government in northern Huila.
=== November ===
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Papua New Guinea 99 km (62 mi) west of Kandrian
column2: West New Britain on November 1 at a depth of 52.0 km (32.3 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).

column1: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck Chile 21 km (13 mi) southeast of Curicó on November 4 at a depth of 90.0 km (55.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).
A magnitude 5.0 earthquake struck the United States 2 km (1.2 mi) west of Cushing
column2: Oklahoma on November 7 at a depth of 5.0 km (3.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). Multiple buildings were damaged and minor injuries were reported.

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of Chile 42 km (26 mi) west northwest of Talcahuano on November 8 at a depth of 20.0 km (12.4 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).
A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck Japan 24 km (15 mi) east northeast of Ishinomaki
column2: Miyagi Prefecture on November 11 at a depth of 42.4 km (26.3 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).

column1: A magnitude 7.8 earthquake struck New Zealand 55 km (34 mi) north northeast of Amberley on November 13 at a depth of 22.0 km (13.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IX (Violent). Ruptures occurred on multiple fault lines in a complex sequence that lasted for about two minutes with the largest amount of energy released far to the north of the epicentre. Two people were killed
column2: and widespread damage was reported across parts of the South Island. A tsunami was also observed
column3: reaching 2.5 m (8 ft 2 in) at Kaikoura.

column1: A magnitude 6.5 earthquake struck New Zealand 19 km (12 mi) north northwest of Kaikoura on November 13 at a depth of 24.0 km (14.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake.

A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck New Zealand 26 km (16 mi) north of Kaikoura on November 13 at a depth of 14.0 km (8.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake.

A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck New Zealand 12 km (7.5 mi) north of Kaikoura on November 13 at a depth of 6.3 km (3.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake.

A magnitude 6.5 earthquake struck New Zealand 41 km (25 mi) west southwest of Kaikoura on November 14 at a depth of 9.0 km (5.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake.
A magnitude 6.5 earthquake struck Argentina 8 km (5.0 mi) northwest of Pocito on November 20 at a depth of 108.0 km (67.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). The quake
column2: the strongest to affect the region in recent years
column3: damaged various houses in San Juan province.

column1: A magnitude 6.9 earthquake struck offshore of Japan 33 km (21 mi) east southeast of Namie
column2: Fukushima Prefecture on November 22 at a depth of 11.7 km (7.3 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). 14 people were injured and more than 1
column3: 900 homes briefly lost electricity. A 60 cm (24 in) tsunami wave was reported in the port of Onahama of Iwaki
column4: Fukushima; a 90 cm (35 in) wave hit Soma
column5: Fukushima; and another wave 1 m (3 ft 3 in) in height struck the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant site after the 6.9 shock. Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshihide Suga said that the spent fuel cooling system of the third reactor at the neighboring Fukushima Daini Nuclear Power Plant had stopped as a result of the earthquake; TEPCO later reported the restart of the spent fuel cooling system after only 100 minutes of stoppage.

column1: A magnitude 6.9 earthquake struck offshore of El Salvador 149 km (93 mi) south southwest of Puerto El Triunfo on November 24 at a depth of 10.3 km (6.4 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). One person died of a heart attack due to shock and fear after hearing a tsunami warning alert.
A magnitude 6.6 earthquake struck the Xinjiang Autonomous Region of China 47 km (29 mi) east northeast of Karakul
column2: Tajikistan on November 25 at a depth of 17.0 km (10.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). One person died when various houses near the epicenter collapsed
column3: and livestock were killed.

column1: A magnitude 5.4 earthquake struck Nepal 19 km (12 mi) west northwest of Namche Bazar on November 27 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate). This quake triggered an avalanche that killed one person and left another injured.

A magnitude 4.4 earthquake struck Poland 1 km (0.62 mi) east southeast of Głogów on November 29 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light). This earthquake caused a mine collapse in Rudna
column2: near the epicenter. Eight miners were killed and five others injured.

column1: === December ===

A magnitude 5.2 earthquake struck Costa Rica 9 km (5.6 mi) northeast of Cartago on December 1 at a depth of 5.0 km (3.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). The earthquake caused landslides and damaged some homes
column2: forcing at least 5 families to move to a community centre.

column1: A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck Peru 44 km (27 mi) northeast of Huarichancara
column2: Puno Region on December 1 at a depth of 12.0 km (7.5 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). At least 40 houses in Lampa Province were damaged
column3: with some suffering total collapse. One person died and 17 others were injured.

column1: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck Indonesia 147 km (91 mi) north northeast of Palu'e Island
column2: East Nusa Tenggara on December 5 at a depth of 526.0 km (326.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of II (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 6.5 earthquake struck Indonesia 14 km (8.7 mi) west northwest of Meureudu
column2: Aceh on December 6 at a depth of 13.0 km (8.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IX (Violent). About 245 buildings collapsed as a result of the quake. 104 people were killed and over 900 were injured
column3: of which 136 suffered serious injuries.

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck China 58 km (36 mi) south southeast of Shihezi in the Xinjiang Autonomous Region on December 8 at a depth of 17.6 km (10.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). Two people were injured
column2: and 25 houses suffered damage in Ürümqi region.

column1: A magnitude 6.6 earthquake struck offshore of the United States 164 km (102 mi) west of Ferndale
column2: California on December 8 at a depth of 8.5 km (5.3 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 7.8 earthquake struck the Solomon Islands 69 km (43 mi) west southwest of Kirakira on December 8 at a depth of 40.0 km (24.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe). Tsunami waves up to 5.0 cm (2.0 in) were measured in New Caledonia and Vanuatu. More than 200 buildings in the southern part of Malaita were damaged and buildings collapsed in Makira; more than 7
column2: 000 people were affected by the quake. An eleven-year-old girl died when a building collapsed.

column1: A magnitude 6.5 earthquake struck the Solomon Islands 79 km (49 mi) west southwest of Kirakira on December 8 at a depth of 12.3 km (7.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake.
A magnitude 4.4 earthquake struck Croatia 2 km (1.2 mi) south southeast of Trogir
column2: Split-Dalmatia county on December 9 at a depth of 22.5 km (14.0 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). The quake caused minor damage in the form of cracked walls and broken windows.

column1: A magnitude 6.9 earthquake struck offshore of the Solomon Islands 92 km (57 mi) west southwest of Kirakira on December 9 at a depth of 19.7 km (12.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake.
A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Papua New Guinea 132 km (82 mi) west northwest of Arawa
column2: Bougainville on December 10 at a depth of 142.6 km (88.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).

column1: A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck offshore of the United States trust territory of the Northern Mariana Islands 97 km (60 mi) north northwest of Farallon de Pajaros on December 14 at a depth of 22.4 km (13.9 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light).
A magnitude 7.9 earthquake struck Papua New Guinea 54 km (34 mi) east of Taron
column2: New Ireland on December 17 at a depth of 94.5 km (58.7 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe). Although tsunami waves up to 8.0 cm (3.1 in) were measured and power was knocked out in some parts of the country
column3: no reports of injuries or damage were reported.

column1: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck offshore of Papua New Guinea 168 km (104 mi) southeast of Taron
column2: New Ireland on December 17 at a depth of 8.4 km (5.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of IV (Light). This was an aftershock of the 7.9 quake.

column1: A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck the Federated States of Micronesia 22 km (14 mi) east southeast of Ngulu Atoll on December 18 at a depth of 19.0 km (11.8 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).
A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck Peru's Ucayali Region 201 km (125 mi) south of Tarauaca
column2: Brazil on December 18 at a depth of 612.0 km (380.3 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of II (Weak).

column1: A magnitude 5.4 earthquake struck Ecuador 6 km (3.7 mi) south southwest of Propicia
column2: Esmeraldas Province on December 19 at a depth of 10.0 km (6.2 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). This earthquake damaged houses
column3: hotels
column4: and caused some landslides in Atacames. Three people died and 47 others were injured.

column1: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck the Solomon Islands 81 km (50 mi) west northwest of Kirakira on December 20 at a depth of 20.0 km (12.4 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VI (Strong). This was an aftershock of the 7.8 quake.
A magnitude 6.7 earthquake struck offshore of Indonesia 283 km (176 mi) east northeast of Dili
column2: East Timor on December 21 at a depth of 152.0 km (94.4 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).

column1: A magnitude 7.6 earthquake struck Chile's Chiloé Island 41 km (25 mi) southwest of Quellón on December 25 at a depth of 38.0 km (23.6 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe). The quake ripped up a road near Lake Tarahuin. 4
column2: 000 people were evacuated in the Los Lagos area after a tsunami warning
column3: but this alert was lifted one hour later.

column1: A magnitude 5.9 earthquake struck Japan 13 km (8.1 mi) northeast of Daigo
column2: Ibaraki Prefecture on December 28 at a depth of 7.0 km (4.3 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of VII (Very strong). Two people were injured during this earthquake.

column1: A magnitude 6.2 earthquake struck Indonesia 29 km (18 mi) south of Tolotangga
column2: West Nusa Tenggara on December 29 at a depth of 79.0 km (49.1 mi). The shock had a maximum intensity of V (Moderate).
